title: Priyanka Chopra channels spring in New York after discussing 'hiding' Nick Jonas marriage
text:
Priyanka Chopra is feeling that spring vibe in New York (Picture: Backgrid)

Priyanka Chopra is clearly still feeling that spring vibe as she headed out in New York, to promote The Sky Is Pink.

And we are absolutely not worthy of the Bollywood actress.

She was spotted clutching dog Diana as they pounded the streets, while on their way to the Today Show.

Despite being well into autumn, the 37-year-old wasn’t ready to let the cold weather in, rocking a calf-length silk floral dress.

Nick Jonas’ wife completed her look by rocking a pair of huge sunglasses, along with strappy pink heels.

Priyanka is currently jetting around the world in a bid to promote her new film, The Sky Is Pink – which follows the story of motivational speaker Aisha Chaudhary, who was diagnosed with pulmonary fibrosis and sadly died when she was 18-yeard-old.

Priyanka was joined by dog Diana for the day (Picture: GC Images)

The movie marks the Quantico star’s return to Bollywood after a three-year gap, and she admitted she was feeling ‘nervous’ about the whole thing.

In a candid chat with Metro.co.uk, she told us: ‘It was after three years that I came back to do a Hindi film, and I’m just really proud that it was this one.

‘I wanted to make sure that whatever movie I did was an immersive experience for me.

‘I did Quantico for three years and played the same character, so I wanted to do something which would make me nervous, you know? And this was absolutely that.’

Priyanka recently opened up about her return to Bollywood (Picture: GC Images)

A lot has changed in her life since she’s been away, most notably that she married Nick Jonas in a lavish wedding at the end of last year.

But Priyanka explained that she and the Jonas Brothers singer aren’t feeling any pressure by sharing their relationship so publicly.

‘We both have had almost 20-year careers as public people, and I think [the attention] is something we’re used to,’ she added.

‘We find our privacy where we need to find it. We both know how to hide very well, and when we have to, we do.

‘But the fact is it’s the life we’ve chosen, and it’s something we know.

‘We’re good, very busy both of us, but we’re doing alright. We’re doing good.’

The Sky Is Pink is released in cinemas on 11 October.
